intro: Lichtensteinia trifida var. palmata, commonly known as the palmate lichensteinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its palmately divided leaves, which give it a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
